TJXB8fuGJqHDMJMOmP882Q.text: My first 24 hours in London were meh. Internet issues, mediocre food, standing in lines in heels - not cool. Which is why I give all thumbs up for Byron. Even if I hadn't ben ravenous when I got there I would've enjoyed it. That being said, the food is a party in your mouth. I don't eat beef so I can't speak to eject traditional burger, but the chicken was cooked to perfection. Cheese thank hand-made skin on chips to go with. Be prepared for food coma. Glorious, cheese induced, food coma.

9SxGxDOx5v4Q3hH8w7PcYw.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had, honestly! The meat stems from happy Scottish cows and has a very distinct and fresh taste, brilliant. I went for the Skinny Burger, i.e. the one without a bun. Instead I got a fantastic salad with an amazing dressing that really knocked me off my socks. The burger came with toppings of avocado, mushrooms and cheese, and went down well  I wish we had a burger company like this in Germany! Def will come back on my next visit to London. I will then, however, make sure to either visit another branch or snatch a table in the comfortable section further away from the kitchen. We were sitting on an extremely narrow table amidst the kitchen exhausts and smelled like freshly grilled burgers ourselves afterwards. This  and the slow paying process, almost forgot about that - is the only reason I can't give 5 stars this time, everything else was just fine!

6HHawMmxfqqn0CFJLe8ihA.text: Byron serves a delicious (in their words "proper") burger with a variety of meats and toppings. My personal favorite is the corn-fed chicken burger - something about the marinade hits the spot perfectly; when combined with a slice of mature cheddar and a side of onion rings (or potatoes, depending on your fancy), it makes a lethal late-night snack. I've rarely had to wait for a table here, so makes a good choice for a spur of the moment meal - despite the lack of wait time, the restaurant is lively and often full of people. A point to note: sides are portioned quite small - without prices to match. Don't expect to get full on just one.

SodjMY3T92BSGP6tD2dqYw.text: Pretty good hamburgers and decent prices.  They cook the burgers to a medium unless you specify otherwise.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere is very casual making it a great place to meetup with friends.  The tables are a bit cramped and the noise level is average.  The american burger with green chilis was HOT!!!!!!

agD-8_qjU3aKid0g6OT9mw.text: After celebrating my 50th birthday at sunset at Stonehenge, my tour returned late. Needing a birthday dinner rather late on a Sunday evening, Easter no less, we happened upon Byron Proper Burger; and what a proper burger it was. It's good to see really great burgers aren't just at home in North Carolina.

rREG20l_N1zCN9GBI_JyoQ.text: Best burger I've ever had, although the cost adds up a bit once you order fries and a shake with your £9 burger. Worth it though.

s-7kUSo2wfAlVeEBfmrEDQ.text: This place is awesome. This was the first real meal my husband and I had after arriving in London. We were jetlagged and we were hungry. Byron was just what we needed. We split the portobello burger which was very tasty (don't forget the HP sauce.) We also had an order of the onion rings which we perfectly cooked. I'm sad we were not in the Kensington area for more than a couple days, I think we would have found our way back to this restaurant!

y7mNG4sten-KBXYNd0sLEA.text: I love burgers. I also am a massive shake fan.......so this place is GOOD FOR ME!!!!  (borat style voice required for the last bit)

qCFxl4pv7vIA988ZKUpEiw.text: Best burgers in London. Anyone who says otherwise is an ignorant wanker. And yes, it is totally unacceptable to review a burger joint when you've only had the chicken sandwich. Yeah I'm talking to you, Peter F.

AKPRqKD1MsbAuWZEu_IadQ.text: I was nearby. I was hungry. I looked for the best star rating on yelp and went in.  Nice interior. Burger was different. I liked but not overrated, but nice enough for lunchtime menu.

dyl0LRxD6H-FjOpdmLV5nA.text: I go here about once a week. The burgers are really good. The service is a little slow.

w3o9Om6yZPhf8rvipLgf1w.text: Was in london a few weeks ago and had a byron burger. Not the greatest burger but it as ok. i loved the fries and the BBQ that they offered. Better than going to burger king right next store. price were also nice. Would go back again in the future.

elP6JoZxkMvX7HL7ubibYQ.text: i dont know what these people are talking about! my husband and i are all about hamburgers, hot dogs, ribs, steaks, meat meat and more meat. byron burgers are the BEST OF THE BEST OF THE BEST burgers we have ever had! patty med well, bacon tender but chewy, bun was so delicious, and best of all the hamburger was intact, it never fell apart. where ever we travel we try to find the best burger. this tops blt burger in las vegas. we hope this burger chain will come to the US!

okBY421pwtgiefYRVP-AOQ.text: My boyfriend and me went there because he was in the mood for burgers and i had a craving for red meat (but steak was too expensive). We ordered the cheese burger (with cheddar), the skinny burger (medium-rare) and the chips and all of it was extremely tasty. The medium rare burger even satisfied my craving, since the beef was good (and not some dry, overly done, hard patty).My side salad was quite small but nonetheless fine. For drinks we had the fresh lemonade (tasty) and the oreo milkshake (fantastic). The staff was extremely friendly, too. I would go there again, anytime, if it was not so far away. :-(

xlqmVKiNYojIoj-1nxM6Ng.text: Americans love their burgers and it's hard to find a good one when traveling. However, Byron's has filled the need for a good American burger - chargrilled, with red onion and cooked medium just the way a burger should be - pink and juicy. trust me, if you want a good old-fashioned Amercian cheeseburger, Byron's is a must-do! And the fried courguetes (zuchini) is good too.

VFSFDRO32q2bjpAvurCCpg.text: When I asked my travel buddy what his favorite meal was during our London/Paris/Rome trip, he replied, "that burger place in Kensington near our hotel."  Did he answer this because I picked that location or was it truly an honest answer?    Hmmmm...... Believable? I think so.  And the beet salad I had there was pretty darn good, too.  Definitely worth the visit if you happen to be in the Glouster area, it's right across from the subway station.  There are lots of cute cafes nearby for dessert or coffee after!

LQrkuZPOOyP1NnRrlEN2fA.text: Although the plate of food presented looked a little sparse for the expense, the burger itself was very juicy and what I call a proper American piece of delight. The portion of fries were also on the small size however they were good ole fashioned french fries not chips masquerading as fries so i was happy to give up quantity for quality. In total the meal was genuinely good. If there is one sidebar comment that must be noted - the burger was a bit on the salty side but otherwise a solid performance. Unlike Burger King next door where you will get a super sized portion without having to shell out some serious sterling to eat a slice of Americana, the price spent (which was around £15 for a burger, fries and coke) was well worth the cost. It is rather expensive when I translate this to American $$$, but when you are craving a burger and want something home spun, Byron hits a home run!

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Cheeseburger, fries and a Coke.

K62_DQwJiBdokjFxciirZQ.text: I think for England, this is going to be as good as it gets.  Actually, it is pretty good.  The onion rings are incredible.  Get those.  The fries are ok.  The burger would fall in the top 20% in the states for sure, and the price is pretty good.The South Kensington location is excellent.

y0ccvaF9QfHZ0SWxL-zhJg.text: So, we were walking up Gloucester Road hungry and fancying a Gourmet Burger Kitchen burger, when I spied this place just before it. I had always wanted to try Byron so we went in. I ordered the blue cheese burger. I was interested to compare it to GBK and it certainly avoids the slightly unusual features of the latter I.e paying before you eat. The burgers areone size at Byron but you can get doubles. The menu says burgers are all medium unless you want it done differently. I was asked and said medium. When it came it was redder than medium. It was ok. The meat is clearly good quality but, unlike GBK, the blue cheese was a smattering of dressing. In GBK you can get actual cheese. I couldn't taste it. The chips were good but the onion rings were all batter. In my view GBK has the edge though there was nothing to actually complain about. Service was good. Next time, I'll cover that extra 30 yards to GBK I think.

KpuiYlc1Sswa7KuXHl9PyA.text: Franchising restaurants with some good burgers. Quality and taste are good. Price of the burger is OK.

Gms9DOgYPTlXNAlORuVKSQ.text: I've been to this Byron several times and it's always just alright.  I always get the chicken burger though so I suppose I don't have a good insight on the actual burgers, which might be delicious.  But the chicken is always quite bland, not bad but nothing to write home about. I did really enjoy the courgette fries and would recommend them though despite them being super greasy (but that's what made them even more delicious).  The service at this particular location is great though.

MVXyW6MvmaS1y306TdJJEA.text: I came here with a group of ~20 around 7:30 (unbelievable, yes, I'm well aware, and also slightly shamefaced about it), and they had room for us, after working some magic with the tables. The food came out promptly, all things considered, though I agree with other reviewers in that the portions are very sparse-looking. My classic burger was delicious though. It really is pink, juicy, and succulent! Slightly pricey though it may be, the atmosphere is wonderful: very posh and really just a happy place to be.(Check out the milkshakes; several of my companions shared one and they looked absolutely divine!)

gwk7snzky6-1mrbxz6NsAg.text: Close to the best onion rings ive ever had. The portobello burger tasted good but the portobello was really small. I was expecting it to be a little bigger. From what i hear the meat burgers are really good and they will cook it any way you like it. Usually burgers here will be dead dead dead well done dead. Go to Paul next door for dessert

8chJwZASbiu_4qdgRX7tJA.text: I am always suspicious of restaurants right next to hotels.  This one happens to be across the street from a slew of hotels on Gloucester Road.  What is a "proper" burger in London?  According to Byron, its grass fed local beef.  Hmm....Sounds Good....Ordered the Byron Burger (basically a cheeseburger with a sauce that reminded me of the sauce on Big Macs).  It's pretty good except I made the mistake of ordering it well done (thinking that Londoners like Parisians mean medium to be rare...NOT).  Because of the type of beef,  it's leaner and came out a little dry.   I don't remember anything about the fries except that I ate them.   The green olives are great!!!  The lemonade was okay.  Definitely alot of locals come to this place...  You'll find the tourists next door at the patisserie, tesco, and burger king.   Not a cheap burger...But I never quite adjusted to calculating 9 pounds to mean $15 bucks a pop.

bWQb9vJ9yokS8HhUFR4kzg.text: Great service and the burger and slaw were really good. I'm glad this is by our hotel and if you want a "proper burger" come here!

CVqNnzodOYRLeg9yzErh4g.text: Small burgers but very good. Best onion rings I had in a while. Good service as well.

TiXhANFX3TlL-r8d-QLhvQ.text: Great Service and Great Food.  I had the Vegetarian Burger twice with the zucchini fries and they were outstanding.

gd68vZMQUpcMeHCQDH5mpg.text: Awesome burgers (still think they're better in the states).  Def try the courgette fries - I was surprised how crispy they were.  The onion rings were a little greasy and wished it was a little crispier.

gSx2F0C2_dpimCg6xno6sg.text: This tasted like any ordinary burger joint in my opinion. Our group was just starving and looking for some place to eat. I say this is just London's version of UMAMI burger, but definitely gives much bigger burgers than UMAMI.

_SCUGHFqvPNvMfXtD0UiVQ.text: Really well located Byron restaurant !Try the february special Big Burger, it's awesome !As usual, only the onion rings are a bit of a down, compared to all the rest (Skinny burger seemed weird at first, but it's really a good deal !)

aa0IBovGNpkos0b0zK7Ftg.text: Stopped in and ordered takeaway and everything was ready within 10 minutes.  The Byron Burger (bacon + cheese) was actually quite tasty and definitely worked when hungry for an american-style burger.Great burger + great chips + takeaway = happy customer!

fekhX-bgdIScbtSmsw0iLg.text: Boyfriend and I ventured to the South Kensington location for some post-museum grub.We had a classic burger, a Byron burger (bacon cheeseburger), hand-cut chips and courgette fries, and we also shared a cheeky chocolate malt milkshake.The food was outstanding, the meat was cooked to perfection and delicious, the size of the burgers is perfect as well, as they are big enough to satisfy a big appetite but not absolutely enormous like some other "gourmet" burgers I've had in other restaurants. The courgette fries were also fried vegetable perfection, lightly battered, crispy and tasted really fresh. Chips and milkshake were nice too, just nothing to get excited about. The service was very friendly and attentive, and our food came out in no time.The only (weak) downside of Byron is that it's a tad overpriced, I feel like for about £10 for a burger they should at least include a side of chips, but we enjoyed the experience nonetheless.With so many locations all over London, Byron is always a safe bet.

31cJLudIbJF_D7-_TzUamw.text: Went there for Saturday lunch with family (read kids aged 10 and under) and Friends (same profile).Kids enjoyed the burgers/shakes, and the service was good, prompt and with smiles. The burgers were ok , but I am not convinced they are the best possible, for a place that claims to specialise in them. Mine was fairly plain, even with the Byron sauce, that sounds great, but actually a bit devoid of taste.Good for kids etc, and so would happily go back. A different experience to my visit to the Soho branch (reviewed seperately), which I would not repeat.

U3VI4sEJSemOSYiCU1ur7A.text: I try not to eat typical "American" food when I travel abroad but I was with a colleague who didn't want anything but.  We went here after exhausting a few other places and they had good, solid American burgers.  I would eat here again if I had the craving for a good burger.

4SMSTzIB0vydAPbTMQ3ypQ.text: I love this place.  I've walked by them many times (e,g, Westfield London) but didn't realize the selection of items.  I ordered the hamburger, strawberry shake and wedge salad.  The shake was HUGE -- they serve it to you in the mixing container.  It was a real shake made with ice cream, milk and strawberries -- I loved it, but it was enough for two people.  The wedge salad was a British version of the American wedge, but I thought it was great -- in true U.K. tradition the salad dressing was on the tame side, but it was tasty.The burger is very high-quality meat, server medium.  The buns were excellent along with the onions, tomatoes (but pickle was on the side instead of dill chips).  My only complaint is the swipe of mayoniase wasn't enough and it made the burger a little bland.  Next time I'm ordering a side of the BBQ sauce.  I also intend to order the onion rings and chicken sandwich which looked good.

nHQzSx73kr_5rV7Gipczog.text: You will always find wonderful burgers at this place. I highly recommend Byrons.

JGp03aUX7cNujHI_ONiChw.text: This may have been the best hamburger I have ever had! "The Byron" was just plain awesome...just wished they had a better selection of IPAs.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Byron burger with fries and a hoppy lager!

FoUdqZYDuGhu0RxxzkDImQ.text: You really have to go there just to taste their courgette fries: they are perfect in size and taste!! Besides you could also enjoy an awsome Oreo milkshake which leads you just one step far from heaven.The burgers are pretty good; the location is nice and simple. You may smell like fries for a little while after you are gone but that is a fair price to pay;)

OBJhOAmUuA25weaIm3gVyA.text: really good meal.....went there twice while in London.  Highly recommend the chicken sandwich without the bun....they provide a 'free' garden salad when you skip the bun, and it was delicious.  Sweet potato fries too.  The whole family loved it.

ey9BJkO7O9zOfrgoGXWICA.text: This burger is great. Reminded me of being home in the States. Staff was friendly,  and helpful. Give it 2 thumbs up.

Odxe-Chwjj054W8SoF722Q.text: Only went once and would not got back again, it wasn't worth the price. Decent burger, just not worth the trip.

JJJZYIc9w0Gc0Yq106q-FA.text: As an American tourist in Europe, I couldn't help but crave a really hearty meal every once in awhile. Byron was always my answer, as while the Gloucester Rd. stop was right by my school, I could always be sure I would find a Byron burger in almost every borough I was in. A cool design element is that each one is decorated differently, and slightly reflects the area it is in (The other south kensington branch is just around the corner but looks much more posh and classic, mirroring the expensive flats surrounding it).I've had the cheese burger, Byron burger, and chicken burger - all fantastic and cooked right to order. I had friends who got the B-rex burger during that monthly promotion and loved it! Their seasonal burgers are definitely ones to try. I also always ordered a side of fries or mac and cheese (because I'm American of course), and the mac and cheese was pretty much to die for. The milkshakes were also great diner food to go along with the burger and fries - Try the oreo cookie milkshake!Very quick service in every location. I would call as I walked out of classes to order something to go, and by the time I got there it was always ready - never more than 20 min!

STotjayLb5cHIT0ewV5U0Q.text: Flip-flopping on Byron.  It's been kind of shit lately, but my wife likes their salad.  I get all excited to eat their mediocre chips, onion rings, etc., and then am guilted into sharing a salad.I feel like they're constantly changing their bread supplier because the buns go from being like a awful stodgy bap to a nice chewy air-pocketed bun back to a bready piece of shit.Skinny chips go from being plain to being coated (probably in corn starch to keep them crispy) back to plain, back to coated.  In any event, I can't stand them coated so it's their hand cut chips for me (yes, they cost a bit more but i'm worth it).I live around the corner so eat here more then I would if I was, say, 5% less lazy.

VfaTA07IZUH6-ZBDy7hEgg.text: This was right down the street from our hotel in S. Kensington. We got to London early, on a cold, windy, rainy day and were not allowed to check in to our hotel for another couple of hours. We were starving and walked in to Byron's, taking a chance that it was good enough. As soon as we opened the door we were greeted with a huge smile and were seated quickly. We received our hamburgers and onion rings soon after we ordered and they were great. My boyfriend got a normal cheeseburger and I got the Byron (if that's the bacon cheeseburger). We were both quite impressed with the hamburgers, but it was the onion rings that were the "wow" factor. We actually came back the next day just to get more onion rings. I can definitely recommend this place and if I ever make my way back to this gorgeous city, I will stopping in.

4VxqM1YQ0VYDGCnQvWK8jw.text: The restaurant has a good atmosphere, laid back and welcoming. The menu has neat graphics and cool designs. I maybe overindulged in a chicken burger, onion rings, and vanilla milkshake. The bun on the burger I didn't particularly enjoy. The milkshake was delicious. My friend had an Oreo shake which was good. Prices are reasonable for London.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Burgers. Onion rings. Milkshakes.

RFEnFcyc0O5zdeC3mNuacQ.text: I just finished what I consider to be a very professional hamburger.  I had a "Byron" with courgette fries and a Bear Republic Racer 5 IPA (brewed in Healdsburg California, a short distance from where I used to live and where my son still lives).  The burger was tasty in every bite, a great balance of bun, bacon, lettuce, tomato, cheese, onion, sauce and burger.  The meat was a little chewy in spots, but that's something I like in burgers; some texture that keeps it from tasting like a pile of mush.  It was tasty down to the last bite without becoming soggy, which was still moist but left only a couple drops of juice on my plate.  No waste at all.The fries were also remarkable, perhaps the best courgette fries I've ever eaten.  Sliced thin and cooked to a near-perfect consistency with a light-but-not-too-light coating of batter.Nothing else need be said about Racer 5, other than noting how clever Byron is to have it on their beer menu.Very attentive staff, although I was there early on a Tuesday and business had not picked up yet.  I heard a few patrons with very specific desires (I was the only one who needed a menu) which I believe were handled accurately.I'm pretty sure I'd go back, except this trip is already too short for the number of dining establishments in the area...

NYe66YEaF43shOrJ8VsBoA.text: If you're looking for a good, American-style burger and fries meal in London that'll only cost you an arm instead of your first born, look no further than Byron.Located a short walk from the South Kensington tube stop, Byron does burgers as well as any you'll find in the states.  Their massive, tasty burgers can come fully equipped with great fries and milkshakes that are to die for (The cookies and cream milkshake was very possibly the best milkshake I've ever had).While great for take-away, Byron is also equipped with a large dining area that is accomodating to both those looking for a quieter evening or parties looking to kick back after work and sit by the bar or outside with a drink or two.  While prices are a bit steep compared to a burger in the states, this is London, and South Kensington at that.  You're here to break the bank as it is, so you'd might as well get your pounds worth.If you're looking for a gourmet burger meal or a quick milkshake, look no further than Byrons.  Possibly the best burger in the city.

25EdmVLrYavWg2pfIvJtqg.text: Being from the States, I occasionally find myself missing an American style hamburger. However, after being introduced to Byron's, I will always have a standby when the urge arises.Byron's produces an excellent hamburger full of flavor and always cooked medium. If you prefer your burger not as red, make sure to tell the waiter. I think their onion rings are quit a bit better than their fries, but both are good. They also make a very good Oreo shake, which I never was a fan of until I had it at Byron's.All that to say, reasonably priced food that tastes amazing and could give some of the gourmet burger chains in the States a run for their money.

baJBUioFkAKYSaNluG1YEw.text: My wife and I had quick dinner here the other day.I had regular burger which was ok, but not great, I've definitely tasted better.My spouse had a burger without a bun (not sure what it's called), which once again was pretty average, though the meat in general was definitely better than in GBK.All in all in terms of food the experience was OK, but we'll probably try something different next time around.The staff at this place was not really friendly, I don't think any one of them smiled at all. We didn't feel welcome.

wFUHRRNOxaJrL-cyRPVqiQ.text: Mad Xenophobic Burgers Beyond ThunderNom. All of Byron's burger joints are in London, which I, frankly, find practically racialist against Scots. I'm sure that many would agree, perhaps we should have a referendum about it? Why does Byron's overt and blatant anti Scottishism get on my boybits so much? Because their burgers are bloody great, that's why! The eponymous Byron burger is a great burger, up there with the best. What disturbs me is the utterly outrageous cost: £9.25 for the Byron Burger and a further £200 or so in travel expenditure from Edinburgh to get it. A damned disgrace. In summary: Great Burgers if you live in London, otherwise, prohibitively expensive to try.

nUseHlrGuNrWrVhpEVI-kg.text: The atmosphere when we first entered the restaurant gave a very good first impression. The interior resembled a meat market with it's checkered floor. And the atmosphere felt very relaxed and the staff very friendly.I went with a canned (unusual!) micro-brewed IPA and the Byron Burger. The burger was a good size and served on a seedless bun. The state of the bread was a slight disappointment as it crumbled and lacked the chewiness of a real good bun. The patty was cooked medium (medium-well-ish) and had a pink center but was still rather dry when I cut into it. The texture was that of a well done patty, just pink. The condiments were excellent though and the "Byron sauce" had a nice flavor  to it. For sides we went with the home made skin-on chips which were excellent, nice flavor, and the onion rings which where a bit too greasy.The service was excellent but the food was just a slight disappointment. I'm not saying Byron's burgers are bad, on the contrary it's actually better than most places, I'm just saying there are better burgers out there.

HmIoUxXdipEbx0lYmMrvZQ.text: The vegetarian burger, which featured portobello mushrooms, roasted red peppers, aioli and goat cheese, was superb and my Oreo milkshake (with malt) was a pleasant reminder of home in the states. A bit expensive for my student budget but a nice treat nonetheless.I've also had the excellent macaroni and cheese, caesar salad, and chips.

8odLrm4oYa775p7hDV6-sQ.text: I thoroughly enjoyed Byron - it is burgers (including chicken and veggie) and chips sort of spot with a great beer menu. It is casual, and doesn't require a lot of planning or pomp, just a good burger joint.The staff is friendly and attentive without hovering, and the prices are very reasonable for the quality of the meal and beer. A great spot for a nice casual meal.

Doy0QBN3KfiLkGScGKpjkw.text: Simply put, it was the best burger I've ever had. Better than In n out in SF and Five Guys or Shake Shack in New York.PS: to the Shake Shack lovers out there, they are opening in Coventry Garden here in London.

JJ9fq7zvc7RHG0AJPlgjCg.text: I absolutely loved the burger's at Byron. The blew the burger's at Gourmet Burger Kitchen right down the street out of the water completely. All of my flat mates and I loved this place and some of them came here at least a couple of times a week. i know they loved the milk shakes, I never tried them as I don't do too well with ice cream and milkshakes are really not my favorite.My favorite burgers were the Veggie Burger and Byron Burger. The sides were also really good and we generally got a couple and shared them. I really liked the fries, homemade skin-on chips, and onion rings. They all were seasoned well and had really great flavor. We also tried the tortilla chips with guacamole, which were delicious as well. As for drinks I generally had the lemonade which was really delicious.Although their burgers were a little bit expensive, the burgers were so fantastic that we splurged here once in a while for their fantastic burgers. When my mom came over to visit this is one of the first places I took her to and she loved it as well.I highly recommend Byron for their food!

NCkE4Vcie_l0v0WB4hLXVA.text: These burgers are really excellent, especially if you're an American missing the States like I was when I went to Byron. They are filling, comforting, and delicious. I ate at the Gloucester Road location and it was not busy so the service was incredibly fast and our waitress was pleasant and attentive. I had the bean burger and it was exceptional -- the patty was crispy on the outside and a wonderful texture on the inside (which you don't always get in a vegetarian option). The fries here, in my own personal opinion, are perfection. They're cut thin and are crisp without being dry, and they also aren't too oily -- I detest a mushy french fry. My friends and I also shared an order of onion rings, and I think it's worth mentioning that they are INCREDIBLY rich. I could only eat two, and my two friends each only had one. So if your table is feeling onion rings, I would recommend starting with one order and asking for more later if you need them. All in all, Byron provides a solid burger experience.

D1vuSGGetF6OJ409_hKpuw.text: my husband and i stepped in at 11:28pm because we saw this place was open (London isn't a great late night dining town in some areas). we were informed that they only do take away for the last half hour - so definitely be warned if your hotel/house isn't nearby. that was a huge bummer.the food was very good, however. i got the byron and he got the double bacon cheese. burgers cooked nicely, fries were good, and we were very pleased with the food.if you don't have dine in the last 30 minutes, then maybe you should adjust the hours, yeah?but if you want a tasty burger near gloucester station, i'd definitely recommend!

sIXrTx-ChcTi4wD-HZitXA.text: Great, friendly, warm  service. Our burgers were legit!  We will definitely eat here again before we leave in three days!

UHU1zdciTrtiP89Ep4s52Q.text: My husband and I (live in southern California) had a 1 night layover in London and given that we had just traveled from North Africa we were CRAVING American food. After looking up local restaurants we settled on Byron for dinner. We LOVED it! The ladies working there were amazingly nice, great, fast, friendly service. We ordered the hot wings, 2 burgers, fries milkshake and lots of tequilla! The burgers were cooked perfectly, not too pink. Everything was fresh, clean and super tasty! Next time we're in London we will definitely return vs. trying our luck on a another new place!

y9K5t01tQM8CoW2_L07oeQ.text: My boyfriend and I had dinner at Byron's Proper Burger in London May 31st 2017. I'm so picky about my burgers that I very seldom go out to have one because I just make the best at home. So when I do have a burger out, the bar is set so high that usually they don't compare, but not this time! The burger was SO good I finished the entire burger along with the zucchini fries (courgette fries) omg Yum! I also had to go here since my love dog in the States is named Byron! 5 star and our waitress Viviana was absolutely the best  #viviana #Byron burger. Just GO! You won't be disappointed! Thank you! Gaynelle

eaBjjqjW-DlWtKDhEFDVOA.text: As an American, Byron is a disappointment. Other than really good service by the Polish waitresses, there weren't many high points. The burgers are way overpriced. The beef is thin and dry. Sides are pricey and aren't included in your order. The fries were okay, but the zucchini fries were limp. People bring their kids here, so it gets a bit loud inside.

zw3EJM8EK6TMs2MZIN621Q.text: Great BURGERS! Went there after joining their burger club (which got us a free burger) we got to sample their newest addition to the menu, 'sweet caroline' which had all sorts of beef and pulled pork deliciousness! it was huge! Also tried the vegetarian bean burger patty which we had with cheddar cheese and accompanied by skinny fries (which were really good!) We went there hoping to get a bottle of prosecco but they were out after a busy weekend which was a little disappointing but it was all sweetened by the bottle of Malbec and the complimentary olives we got instead!The actual restaurant has a really cool vibe and its a good place to go and catch up with friends! Highly recommend it..

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. B.U.R.G.E.R.S

A17x-Ys2P7QpF780YGHPgQ.text: My wife and I stooped into Byron for a burger after a long day on a bus touring Salisbury, Stonehenge and Bath. The bus dropped us off next to Gloucester Road tube station, so we decided to grab a burger here before heading to our flat.The service was extremely helpful here. My wife has a gluten allergy, and the server was completely understanding and helped us find an option that was safe and delicious (any burger can be "skinny" with no bun and a salad added). The size of the burger was perfect for us - a 6 ounce patty is just right when you omit the bun. It was cooked just right, too.We weren't expecting much, but I think we would actively seek out Byron again if we were looking for a burger. It was yummy.

a1hqutkyZIk5tPmvx4nQuA.text: We stopped into the Gloucester Rd Byron's after a long day of touring outside of London.  Needed food that would fill us up- quickly!    The waitresses were attentive enough and we placed our order of cheeseburgers pretty quickly.  Because we were starving- I ordered nachos off the "starter" menu.  After a little while- our burgers were brought out to us... no nachos.  Our waitress noticed and brought out the nachos AFTER the burgers- and apologized.    The burgers were pretty delicious & I ate every bite.  The nachos, on the other hand were pitiful.  They had pico de gallo, sour cream, and guacamole in nice sized servings plopped on top. The problem was the cheese... or lack thereof.  I found (literally) ONE chip that had some melted cheese on it.    Stick with the burgers.

vyD3vE_o0VolTpzuvwwNQw.text: Good fast service, basic burgers with fun toppings and sides. Mine was medium rare but came medium so bit over cooked but otherwise a fun spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. The skinny, no bun burger

TH0xrw6XyhzgvGAVEcxpng.text: I had my first experience yesterday when my wife and I stumbled across this little gem but it was their bigger location in the city. We ordered the Old Smokey on the waiters recommendation and both loved it. I also am a huge fan of the Thatchers Old Rascal cider, I need to order some when I get back to Oz. The wifey was full from lunch today and I spotted this smaller location down the road from where we are staying at The Rydges. I ordered the Chilli Queen and I think I loved it even more, spicy on a well cooked patty with a little of that charred flavour I adore, with delicious melted American jack cheese. Amazing!!I might look in to franchising rights for Australia!

Qhm18xvk5MR9RQel8KDVsQ.text: Very good milkshakes! I had the Oreo cookie one- absolutely to die for. The burgers are good too, but they get expensive quickly. Didn't like the onion rings too much- too crispy and the actual onions didn't seem cooked. The service was great when I went!

kFxNYGzsDa4hqXM4-gHyjA.text: I was staying across the street at the Gloucester Millennium and wanted something simple and accessible for dinner.  No seared foie gras or confit of something that was not meant to confit-ed.  I get no more than 50 meters from the hotel and see the orange awning of Byron.  Byron is an new-American styled burger place.  I peeped the menu and was sold.  The decor was sleek and modern, the waitstaff was young and friendly, and the dinner crowd was lively.  The drink list was not only full of beer, but also had a nice wine selection.  I had a glass of malbec.  Red wine and cheeseburgers are a fantastic combo.  I had the Byron - burger with cheddar cheese, bacon and thousand island / Russian dressing.  I ordered chips, which the menu called "french fries" as a nod to the American theme.I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and the service here.  If I stay in any of the area hotels again, I am definitely coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

Z0UPljLg-Z8tPWhqekhSzQ.text: Every time I'm in London I make sure I come to Byron for a burger! Their food is really good and waiters are also nice. I always get the Byron Burger! Their fries (they call them chips in London!) are also awesome!

9slqIDcaFnmEkCSA9HtZLg.text: That's one tasty burger but the rings are rubbish. This is a proper Yank hamburger. Punk IPA was good. Nice hopyness without a strong, bitter aftertaste. Gizz-Mo burger created by Gizzi Erskine in honoregistered MovemberWelsh, a Welsh Rarebit with cheddar and Worcestershire sauce with a 50p donation to the cause. I'll go with a Byron to try his special sauce.It's a simple, meat market feel with white tile floors and walls. Blank walls without art and sparse lighting make it a drab feel. The only spice is on the table in the form f Cholula hot sauce. Not sure how many Londoners use it but they should.I've tried burgers from various joints around LDN and the tops would be Gourmet and Byron. Both have fairly similar but I would say Bryon is closer to the State's staple meal. I don't get the onion rings. The light batter with herbs an pepper does not make a proper ring. Not sure what it is but I'm no fan. The french fries looked better. All together me meal was £15.45 and worth it. I would return to sample other burgers with fries and try a shake. Those too look good.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful craft beer
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Onion Rings

bjXL7j7dTB6w1DDv7XeuMA.text: Good comfort food and great service. The Gloucester road branch is one of the quieter Byrons. Great location just across the road from the underground station. The burgers are pretty good for an European burgers. Much better than most other offerings in town. You can call and  pick up your order in 15 mins

aRowtnTgmSNEw0dPQcDezA.text: I love burgers, and I LOVE hot sauce. So the chilli burger at Byron really is my idea of food heaven. Luckily, or not so luckily for my waistline, I have a branch literally 5 minutes from my office so I often head there with my colleagues to indulge in one of my favourite meals!The chilli burger contains a 6oz hamburger smothered with green chilli, American cheese, shredded iceberg and chipotle mayonnaise and I always order extra avocado to go inside. As a rule i order my steaks rare and my burgers medium rare. I like my beef  to be still moo-ing when it hits my plate. The burgers at Byron always come perfectly cooked with the right balance of pink and charring to add flavour.One of the other draws to Byron, aside from the namesake burgers , is the courgette fries. Trust me, once you've tried these, you won't ever order regular fries again! they are basically soft and juicy courgette stripes fried tempura style in a light, crispy batter....all that you need is a nice glass of Fentimans ginger beer to wash it all down! absolute perfection!

dSpssEOTty_mol2HokcTlQ.text: After a long final day in London, we were so thankful for the Byron establishment on Gloucester Road. The waitstaff is diligent and eager to seat us, however, they were VERY busy! The burger and fixings were juicy and delicious. Should we return to the area, we will definitely be back!

ArsnC9QHY9HYAg4KD8wuMw.text: Last week I just felt like grabbing a cheeseburger with fries without any fuss...I guess I was missing New York.I so want to like Byron, but I'm ALWAYS disappointed.There's something very ungenerous about the place. The burgers seem small and the cheese, whichever one you choose, is always thin. It's as though they work out how to give their customers as little as possible.I expect to feel STUFFED after a cheeseburger, but I always come away from this place feeling like I haven't really been fed. On top of that, the atmosphere is bland.I'm amazed that so many American yelpers give this place the thumbs up.GBK is far superior.

ms9Etvyxz9SOMhX7siKHRQ.text: I just ate the best burger I've ever tasted! My husband and I split two different burgers, he ordered the Byron, while I ordered the Mo'Shroom. Both burgers were quite tasty, the patties themselves were seasoned well, and we're cooked to perfection. My favorite was the Mo'Shroom burger, the cheese and sauce were flavorful but not overwhelming, and the veggies were perfect! Is it expensive? Yes. Is it worth it? Absolutely!!

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. The flavorful Mo'Shroom burger, with a side of courgette  (zucchini) fries and fresh squeezed lemonade.

WMzKwhkMEZCGN6RGAKizGg.text: After a long flight and checking into my hotel, I needed to grab a bite to eat and a beer. I searched for close places and found this burger spot (yes I know, my first stop as an American is a burger spot). Thy struck my attention because they sold American IPAs, my favorite kind of beer back in the states (once again, I know, I should be drinking English ales and such instead of trying my usual comforts). So, as an American, hell, as a Texan, I know good burgers. And this Byron burger was up there with any other quality gourmet burger I've had in the states. The vegetables seemed fresh, the meat was of good quality, I believe Scottish cows, and the cheese, bun and Byron's sauce all were very nice. I got the courgette fries (fried zucchini) where also very tasty (as a Texan I grew op on fried squash). Also, they have a good selection of beers and a few American IPAs like Odell's IPA from Colorado (scored very high on beer advocate and ratebeer). Burgers, beer, this American has no complaints. I came to see that these places are all over London but for a chain place, it's definitely 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Byron Burger and fried Zucchini

lojer-WCFrtaByLSrQsjqg.text: We decided to stop here for dinner after spending the whole day traveling from the US and I'm so glad we did! The employees were extremely friendly and welcoming and did all they could to make sure we were comfortable. The food was AMAZING! Fantastic burger, delicious fries, but the courgette (zucchini) fries were the best part.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Smashed avocado burger with fries!

q3AHTgDiN1r6FCW44ZVHwA.text: They recently changed the menu, but it's still as good as ever. Friendly staff, great burgers, decent prices. Even though it's a chain, I do enjoy Byron's. And this location has some of the best service I've ever seen. Remember to collect your playing cards

0KvCt3cuf3KLVObF8XVynQ.text: This was a great find near Hyde Park! I got a flex burger which was made of mushroom and beef, and it was great! They also had vegan and veggie options. My friend got a regular hamburger and really liked that as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

D_gMc4X8U4QzRqCrRBf4CQ.text: Overall this is a good burger place. Coming from the states where we have tons of great burger places, it's hard to blow my mind with a burger. But the burgers here are good. I got the Byron burger, which had good flavor and was cooked well. We ordered the nachos to start, and I wouldn't do that again. They were pretty cold when we got them and not much to them. We ordered a chocolate shake to finish things off and it was very good. It came in the tall stainless steel cup, so it was quite large and enough for two. Service was awesome and very friendly. Would not hesitate to go again when in London.

GIv1PQR8q3F9KkGRHrdT4g.text: Very good burgers and beer selection.  Attentive service.  Best burger I had in London.  Shakes are great.

tuGdKzUOe8NUmuLxyTNxGA.text: Lovely spotHad the burger and it was delicious and good choices of drinks.   Customer service is also great and friendly.   Worth going again

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

q91tiO36VL44FNQfDrBVug.text: Very good burger. I always get a bit suspicious when i see "American" restaurants, since most people in the USA can't tell you what an "American" restaurant looks like.  However, this place is a great burger joint, something is Americans are VERY familiar with. Good burgers with great options, an excellent beer selection, and some very legit milkshake options. Very attentive, friendly staff, and a good burger joint ambiance. A great place to fill those low key cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

p7M8-h9-gpSk04h5PHLpKQ.text: Being in London for over a week, my brother and I were craving burgers! We were staying just up the street and it was a short 5 minute walk. We were greeted and seated right away, taken our drink order and our meal order quickly! We loved the service the best service we've had since being in London. We ordered the nachos to start off and they were soooo goood. It was way better then we had expected. To drink I had a strawberry milkshake that had real strawberry bits inside... YUM. We were brought water without asking which hadn't been done at any other place we've eaten in London.I had the E-Rex burger medium cooked and it was to die for. The portion sizes are rather big so I'd recommend sharing. Overall, we had a wonderful experience because our waitress went above and beyond from the beginning.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

DRHBshC_xO1KDR6XHbKfIQ.text: The service and the food here is just perfect. I went by myself and loved it so much that I brought my fiancé the next day. I had the classic cheese one day and the Byron cheese the next. My fiancé had a C-Rex which was a crispy chicken sandwich with amazingness on it. The burgers are cooked at medium and are incredibly juicy. Their fries are great and onion rings are massive. It took everything in me not to go there for a third time.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Classic cheese and C-Rex
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Chilled glasses for your drink.

sDcxYXfIizVf4HmsSvwkaQ.text: Visiting London from NY.  Wanted quick bite after exiting Earl's Court underground station.  Ordered a take out burger from this place.  This one-star review is for the nasty waitress that took my order.  So rude!  Condescending tone, complete with eye roll when asking about the different burgers they have.  Note to owner of this place: you should fire the girl.   She is not doing your restaurant any good.

pW444Zj7Z9M7Ezz5KSAjHQ.text: An awesome place to get a burger and a cider. I had their Byron burger on a gluten-free bun and it was simply fantastic. Definitely worth checking out.

eZKPGfkZxRy2NYziFmMkww.text: Let's be honest if you are looking for a good burger go to Honest Burger P.S. The bloody Mary's blow

g00tIv0SN5FaBs0EuAbXLA.text: Great, proper, American burger. Best we've ever had out of the states. And if I were honest better than some in the states too! And you can order it medium rare!

m1cwMO0fmvKtleV8nEfDEQ.text: If you're in the mood for a burger and don't want fast food this is a great choice.  While it is a chain they do make some tasty burgers. I've always been satisfied with my orders and will definitely come back.  I've had a regular hamburger and well as a bacon bbq burger and both were good.  Fries are small- medium size in thickness. Menu is robust and offers non beef options as well.  I'm a fan!

OcT8xKkzEFMA1seZouihhQ.text: Awesome burger! Everything here is large scale. Shakes, burgers, sides! Roomy dining area. Very nice wait staff. You will not leave hungry.

X_W8JpQHbeZZLoF2L2eTOw.text: Byron was fantastic! The food was on point: big burgers, hot fries, cold drinks, and the chocolate brownie with ice cream was SPECTACULAR! This was on the same level as expensive burgers in the US, but WAY CHEAPER!

pO5poxBgtqbtWl7dyh7KlA.text: Simple good tasty burgers.  Good service.  Across the street from glouster. Tube station

vbsewJwL18P6JpPUDrC0mw.text: Service and food were great! Ate here for lunch and dinner while staying at a nearby hotel. Mississippi shake lacks a bit of the toppings but other shake flavors were great.

wEoHe2AVfYZKOnVKAiLbQA.text: I stopped in Byron while visiting London. After being in London for the better part of six days, I was in desperate need of some kind of American food. I stumbled upon Byron and I smiled instantaneously. In America, we love our burgers. so I was curious to see how Byron measured up according to my taste buds.As I scanned the menu, I saw that the burgers were slightly expensive. I said to myself, "oh well, I'm I tourist". I ordered a fresh squeezed lemonade at it was delicious. Its really difficult to master a good fresh squeezed lemonade. It was definitely worth a try. The menu had a nice selection of alcoholic beverages to choose from as well. For my burger entree I ordered the Double Bacon Cheese burger with a side of skin on fries. The burger was eh.....ok I guess. I wish I could have added lettuce to it but I was starving and was just happy to have some American food for the first time during my stay.The Byron Sauce is what stood out to me. It was so tasty that I asked my waitress if I could purchase a couple of bottles to take back home with me to the states. She looked at me stated that they weren't for sale and nobody has made that request to her before.At that point there was no way I was leaving the restaurant without a bottle of Byron Sauce. So I called the Manager over to my table and let him know that I wanted to buy a few bottles to take home. He said "of course we sell our bottles of Byron sauce". So he charged me a few bucks for two bottles. I forgot to mention that the manager had the most EPIC handlebar mustache I've seen. He was very helpful in making that upsell.Overall, it was an ok experience. Byron served its purpose for me during my visit. I've had better burgers at home. When I come back to London, I will visit Byron for sure....only to buy a few bottles of Byron Sauce. (Not unless I can order it online)

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Purchased two bottles of Byron sauce to take home.
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Double Bacon Cheese with skin on fries and fresh squeezed Lemonade.

GEl5lGmV9UbkbSzwPFOrMQ.text: After 11 days in Italy we found ourselves craving something besides pasta.  We needed something other than pizza.  We needed a burger.  Enter Byron's. Located right across the street from the Gloucester Road station it's really easy to find.  And around 12:30 on a Sunday there were plenty of seats.Byron's is modern, yet comfortable.  Staff is friendly and they make up a mean burger.  Both the Hubs and I ordered the BYRON Burger - with bacon, cheddar, shredded iceberg, tomato, red onion and Byron sauce.  At £9.25 the dish doesn't come with fries which is a bit of a bummer, and in turn a bit expensive.  But we made sure to add a couple sides to try.  The fries (£2.95) were mighty tasty.  The order come in a nice size bowl that's easy to share.  We also ordered up the courgette fries (fried zucchini sticks) (£3.25).  I didn't love these...I guess I'd rather just stick to fresh/crisp zucchini instead of fried.  Hubs liked them though.We ended with milkshakes to go.  Yum.We spent about £32 ($55) on two burgers, two sides and two shakes.  Which, generally, is a bit expensive for us but overall - Byron's a really good meal.  Burger was seasoned nicely and cooked as asked.  Soft bun.  And I'm usually not fan of "secret sauces" but this one is really tasty, don't go without it.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Byron Burger
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. courgette fries (fried zucchini sticks) (3.25)
